0;1;2;3;4;Answer: An atom stays in an excited state for about:;(a) 10 micro seconds;(b) 10 milli seconds;(c) 10 nano seconds;(d) 10 seconds;(c) 10 nano seconds

Who explained the splitting of special lines in magnetic field?;(a) Zeeman;(b) Bohr;(c) Summerfield;(d) Einstein;(a) Zeeman
Isobars have the same:;(a) A;(b) Z;(c) N;(d) All the above;(a) A
Isotones have the same:;(a) A;(b) Z;(c) N;(d) All the above;(c) N
Half-life of a substance depends on:;(a) pressure;(b) temperature;(c) density;(d) None of these;(d) None of these
The concept of electron spin was introduced by:;(a) Becquerel;(b) Goudsmit;(c) Millikan;(d) Uhlenbeek and Goudsmit;(d) Uhlenbeek and Goudsmit
The principle that a quantum orbital cannot be occupied by more than two electrons was given by:;(a) Pauli;(b) Millikan;(c) Hund;(d) None of these;(a) Pauli

Fg and Fe represents the gravitational and electrostatic force respectively between two electrons situated at some distance the ratio \(\frac{F_g}{F_e}\) is if the order of:;(a) 9.8;(b) 109;(c) 1042;(d) 10-42;(d) 10-42
Artificial radioactivity was discovered by:;(a) Joliot;(b) Becquerel;(c) Pauli;(d) None of these;(a) Joliot

Transmutation of nuclei was discovered by:;(a) Rutherford;(b) Becquerel;(c) Pauli;(d) None of these;(a) Rutherford
The energy equivalent to mass defect is called :;(a) binding energy;(b) internal energy;(c) external energy;(d) enthalpy;(a) binding energy
